grammarNote.title: は vs. が
grammarNote.explanation:
Watch ムーミン on the beach. He spots something: 貝殻があった！ — が marks the shell as a discovery.

The next line: この貝殻はいい！ — は marks the same shell, now established, being commented on.

が = the moment of noticing. は = talking about something already in view.

Watch this shift throughout the chapter: が appears at moments of surprise, は appears when commenting on something established.

vocabulary.meaning: to be visible, can be seen
